description: Construction of single storey detached dwelling with associated excavation to provide basement level and removal of the street tree(following the demolition of existing garages)
decision_conditions: The development to which this permission relates shall be begun not later than the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.
Reason: To comply with Section 91 of the Town & Country Planning Act 1990

| The development hereby approved shall be carried out in accordance with drawing title number(s):- Arboricultural Planning Report dated 04/04/2018 ref-18 1499, Daylight & Sunlight Report dated May 2018 ref-2039/1, 630_01_001 EXISTING LOCATION PLAN, 630_02_001 EXISTING BLOCK PLAN, 630_02_101 PROPOSED BLOCK PLAN, 630_03_001 EXISTING SITE PLAN, 630_03_002 EXISTING FLOOR PLAN, 630_03_100 Rev. G PROPOSED BASEMENT FLOOR PLAN, 630_03_101 Rev. G PROPOSED GROUND FLOOR PLAN, 630_03_102 Rev. G PROPOSED ROOF PLAN, 630_04_106 Rev. G PROPOSED SECTION AA' BB & CC', 630_05_001 FRONT (WEST) ELEVATION, 630_05_002 SIDE (SOUTH) ELEVATION, 630_05_003 SIDE (NORTH) ELEVATION, 630_05_103 Rev. G PROPOSED FRONT (WEST) ELEVATION, 630_05_104 Rev. G PROPOSED REAR (EAST) ELEVATION, 630_05_105 Rev. G PROPOSED SIDE (NORTH & SOUTH) ELEVATIONS,

Reason: For the avoidance of doubt, and in the interests of proper planning. | Notwithstanding any information submitted with this application, details of the materials to be used for the external surfaces shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority before any part of the development hereby approved is commenced. The details shall be fully implemented as approved.

Reason: To ensure that the materials harmonise with the surroundings in accordance with the Council's adopted Ealing Development Management DPD (2013) policies 7.4 and 7B, policies 1.1 (h), 1.2 (g) and 2.10 of the adopted Local Development Framework (Core Strategy 2012) and policies 7.4 and 7.6 of the London Plan (2016). | Prior to first occupation, the refuse and recycling storage areas shown in the submitted drawings shall be implemented and retained thereafter.

Reason: To protect the living conditions of occupiers of the area and in the interests of the future occupants of the development in accordance with policies with policies 3.5 and 7B of the Ealing Development Management Plan 2013, policies 1.1 (e) of the Adopted Ealing Development (Core) Strategy and The London Plan (2015) policy 5.16. | Prior to the first occupation of the development hereby approved, the existing vehicular crossover on Windsor Road of the site shall be stopped up and the area to the front of the crossover reinstated as a public footway.

Reason: To ensure that the development harmonise with the surroundings and in the interests of pedestrian and highway safety in accordance with policies 1.1 and 1.2 of the Development (Core) Strategy (2012), policies LV 6.13 of Ealing Development Management Development Plan (2013) and policies 6.3, 6.13, 7.4 and 7.6 of the London Plan (2016). | No part of the flat roofs of the hereby approved development shall be used as or altered to form a balcony, roof terrace/garden or similar amenity area.

Reason: To protect the living conditions of occupants of nearby properties and future occupiers of the development, in accordance with policies 7B and 7D of the Ealing Development Management Plan (2013). | No windows or other openings (other than those shown on the approved plans) shall be formed in the walls or roof of the building permitted.

Reason: To protect residential amenity, in accordance with policies 1.1 & 1.2 of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policies 7.4 & 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policies 7.4 & 7.6 of the London Plan (2015), and the National Planning Policy Framework (2012). | Notwithstanding the provisions of the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) Order 2015 (as amended), or any other order revoking and re-enacting that order, with or without modifications, no works shall be carried out without the prior permission of the Local Planning Authority, obtained through the submission of a planning application.

Reason: To prevent the overdevelopment of the site and to safeguard the living conditions of occupiers of adjoining properties and the appearance of the streetscene, in accordance with policies 1.1 (g) and (h) of the Adopted Development (Core) Strategy (2012), and policies 7.4 and 7.6 of the London Plan (2016) and policies Ealing Local Variation of London Plan Policy 7.4 and 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan (2013). | Building envelope insulation for the approved residential building, with windows shut and other means of ventilation provided, shall be installed to achieve the internal noise targets adopted by the Local Planning Authority:
a. Bedrooms (23.00-07.00 hrs) 30 dB LAeq and 45 dB Lmax (fast).
b. Living rooms (07.00-23.00 hrs) 35 dB LAeq.
c. Kitchens, bathrooms, WC and utility rooms (07.00-23.00 hrs) 45 dB LAeq.
The sound insulation measures shall be installed and fully completed prior to the first use and / or first occupation of the flats and maintained thereafter.

Reason: To protect residential amenity, in accordance with policies 7.15 of the London Plan (2016); policy 1.1 (j) of the Ealing Development (Core) Strategy (adopted 2012); policy 7A of the Ealing Development Management DPD (adopted 2013) and interim SPG10: Noise and Vibration. | No trees, shrubs or hedges within the site which are shown to be retained and protected under the Arboricultural Planning Report prepared by Arb Consultancy Ltd ref. 18 1499 rev 1 dated 04/04/2018; shall be felled, uprooted, wilfully damaged or destroyed, cut back in any way or removed. Protection of any trees, shrubs and groups of mature trees that are adjacent/close to the subject site shall be carried out only in accordance with the mitigation measures outlined with  Arboricultural Planning Report prepared by Arb Consultancy Ltd ref. 18 1499 rev 1 dated 04/04/2018 and British Standard 5837:2012 'Trees in Relation To Construction Recommendations' (or any subsequent revision), and shall be maintained fully intact and (in the case of fencing/boundary treatment) at all times, until the completion of the development hereby approved.

Reason: In order to safeguard trees other vegetation considered to be worthy of retention and protection, in the interest of the visual amenity of the area as a whole, in accordance with policies 7.4 and 7.6 of the London Plan (2016), policies 1.1, 1.2, 3.1 and 3.8 of the Ealing Development (Core) Strategy (2012) and policies 2.18, 5.10, 7.4, 7A, 7B and EA of the Ealing DPD (2013). | Prior to the commencement of development, a Construction Management Plan shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. The plan shall include the following:
Details of construction hours;

A restriction that the footpath and carriageway on Edgehill Road is not blocked during construction. No encroachment on the clear space needed to maintain the safe and uninterrupted flow of road users and pedestrians;
Noise mitigation and monitoring measures;
Details of enclosure of working areas and the location of compounds for the storage of plant and materials;
Site security during construction;
A detailed statement relating to the excavation and construction of the basement. The statement shall include details of:
i.	Phasing and programming
ii.	Removal of earth from site
iii.	Construction methods
iv.	Site management and access
v.	Vehicle and machinery specifications
vi.	Numbers / frequency of vehicles/deliveries.

vii.	Noise/Vibration mitigation measures. Information submitted should directly cross-reference with the BPM & mitigation measures as detailed in the BS 5228-1:2009 - Code of practice for noise & vibration control on construction & open sites-Part 1: Noise. Procedures for on-site contractors to deal with complaints from local residents.

The Construction Management Plan shall be implemented on commencement of any works on site and the site shall be managed in accordance with the approved plan for the duration of demolition and construction.

Reason: In the interests of the amenity of adjoining occupiers and to minimise highway and traffic impact during the course of the works, in accordance with policies 1.1 (e) (f) (j) of the Ealing Development (Core) Strategy (2012), policy 7A of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan (2013) and policy 6.3 of the London Plan (2016). | No below-ground works shall commence until the following components of a scheme to deal with the risks associated with contamination of the site, have been submitted to and approved in writing by the local planning authority:

a. In the event of contamination to land and/or water being encountered, no development shall continue until a programme of investigation and/or remedial work to include methods of monitoring and certification of such work undertaken has been submitted and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. None of the development shall be occupied until the approved remedial works, monitoring and certification of the works have been carried out and a full validation report has been submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority.

b. In the event that no contamination is encountered, the developer shall provide a written statement to the Local Planning Authority confirming that this was the case, and only after written approval by the Local Planning Authority shall the development be occupied.

Reason: To ensure that any ground and water contamination is identified and adequately addressed to ensure the safety of the development, the environment and to ensure the site is suitable for the proposed use.
